revision.text: ==English== [[File:Chakrasamvara Vajravarahi.jpg|thumb|A painting depicting the '''yidam''' Chakrasamvara]] {{wikipedia}} ===Etymology=== from {{uder|en|bo|ཡི་དམ}}, (Sanskrit: {{m|sa|समादान|tr=samādān}}<ref>{{cite|type=book|author=Lokesh Chandra|year=1976|title=Tibetan-Sanskrit Dictionary|page=2148}} </ref> or {{m|sa|སམཱདཱནི|tr=samādāni}})<ref>སཾ་བོད་རྒྱ་གསུམ་ཤན་སྦྱར་གྱི་ཚིག་མཛོད། (Sanskrit-Tibetan-Chinese Dictionary)(p 615) </ref> The word is said to be a contraction of {{m|bo|ཡིད་ཀྱི་དམ་ཚིག}}, which means to bind one’s mind {{m|bo|ཡིད}}་ by promise་{{m|bo|དམ་ཚིག}}.་ ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|Tibetan Buddhism}} A type of deity associated with tantric or [[Vajrayana]] [[Buddhism]] said to be manifestations of Buddhahood or enlightened mind. #* {{quote-book|en|title=The Collected Works of Chogyam Trungpa|volume=7|author=Chogyam Trungpa|passage='''Yidams''' are not to be equated with the patron saints or guardian angels found in the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim traditions.|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=172yMBZKvpEC&lpg=PA272&dq=%22yidams%22&pg=PA272#v=onepage&q=%22yidams%22&f=false|year=2004}} ===References=== <references/> ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=adimy|yadim}} [[Category:English 2-syllable words]] [[Category:en:Buddhist deities]]
